inn1.comm: full and hint of in swing, around the off stump, driven to mid-off.
beaten by a probing delivery outside off. It landed in a length and shaped in a touch, the batsman pushed in side the line

Powell makes a mess at wide third man. Tharanga had squeezed a length delivery off the outer edge to Powell who lets the ball slip through his fingers. He shakes his head in disgust. Taylor stares. The crowd boo.
full and on the middle stump line, coming in a touch, Tharanga tries to flick, the bat-handle rotates in the hand and the ball goes in the air but falls short to the right of square leg
Fidel Edwards makes a good stop at long leg. Tharanga had got his flick right this time and Edwards made a diving stop near the ropes.
full in length, pushed to right of mid-off.
Fullish, on the legs, leans forward to play a neat pick-up shot over square leg
screaming yorker, on the middle and leg, gets his bat down in real hurry and squeezes it off the inside edge
fullish, on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
mistimes a off drive to mid-off
In the zone outside off stump and is left alone
well outside off and again, left alone
short of length, slanted across and guided to third man where Powell fields. Yeah fields cleanly! and the crowd heckle him a touch and he smiles.
on a length, around the off stump, the batsman reacted as if it jumped a bit more than he expected as he arched back and stabbed it to the off side
leans forward to defend a full delivery to covers
short of length, outside off and steered to backward point
probing line outside off stump and left alone
down the leg side, brushes the thigh pad and Ramdin is late on the dive.
cracking square drive. Full and outside off, carved through cover point.
straighter, on the middle, tapped to square leg
shortens the length, pushes it across the batsman who watches it sail past him
lands on a length, on the middle, cuts in a touch, climbs and thuds into the thigh pad
lands on a length, on the middle, cuts in a touch, climbs and thuds into the thigh pad
fuller, just outside off stump, Tharanga crouches and steers it to backward point
on a length, just outside off stump, straightening a touch, Tharanga is cramped up, takes out the bottom-hand off the handle, and squeezes the ball to point
shorter in length, outside off stump and punched to point
straightens after landing on a length, around the middle and defended to the off side
Thwack! Short and outside off, slapped over cover point. SL have moved to 26.
from round the stumps, on the middle and leg, short of length, tucked past the short fine-leg fielder (Sarwan)
way way outside off stump.

swung to midwicket boundary. It came in from the round-the-stumps angle, full and on the middle, Udawatte took out the front leg out of the line and went across the line. He wanted to hit it to wide mid-on region and it ended up running away to midwicket boundary. The second four off the over.
pushes it across Udawatte who shoulders arms.
Swing and a miss. Full, outside off and Udawatte had a almighty heave but no wood on leather
Action replay. Udawatte is really going hard at the delivery.
short in length, outside off and punched to covers
on a length, at the body, clipped to square leg
banged it short, it climbs chest-high and the batsman lets Ramdin gather
another short one, at the body this time and defended to the off side

yet another short one. Again well directed and Udawatte sways away at the last minute. This is good cricket from Taylor and Udawatte too adjusted well to get away from the line. Short, fast, furious and accurate.
in the zone outside off, Tharanga tries to cover drive but misses the line completely
Fuller but the same result. Tharanga ends up driving inside the line, the bat meets thin air and the ball flies to Ramdin
Three in a row. Tharanga is not coming to the line nor does is he leaning across and again he is beaten on the drive
shorter, on the middle, straightens and Tharanga lets the ball fly over the middle stump. He left it on the length.
81 mph delivery in the channel outside off stump and Tharanga, who was beaten thrice on the drive, doesn't offer a stroke this time
Finally he connects one. Overpitched delivery but it still had to be put away and he eased it through covers
turned to short fine-leg fielder
banged in short, climbs chest-high, on the off stump line, fended to the off side, wants a single and retreats in time

Done in by the slower one. He rolled his fingers around the ball and Udawatte was early into his lofted square drive and it went high, really high, in air towards backward point where Chattergoon stationed himself. It swerved in the air as it dropped down, Chattergoon ran towards his right, stopped, went left, moved right and some how, managed to hang on to the delivery, lunging to his left at the last minute.
short of length, on the middle, defended to the off side
on the middle stump line and defended on the back foot
Full and outside off, left alone
yorker length, outside off, jabbed to the off side
pushed well outside off and Sanga doesn't chase
short in length and shaping away from Sanga who again doesn't offer a stroke
fuller, outside off and guided to Taylor at wide third man
lands it short of length around off stump and moves it away, left alone by Sanga
again Sanga doesn't play at a length delivery outside off stump. SL are on 39 for 1 and we are in the 11th over
pretty short in length and outside off, left alone by Sanga. He would have been tempted to have a crack at it
fuller, straighter and the wrists of Sanga comes into play as he turns it to left of mid-on but Sarwan makes a tumbling stop to prevent any chance of the second run
leans forward to drive to extra cover
short in length, just outside off stump, pushed to covers
full and driven to covers
full and angling across, left alone
full pitched, outside off, driven crisply through cover point and Bravo makes a fine diving sliding stop near the ropes to pull the ball back in.
just past the diving second slip fielder. Sammy was the man. It climbed up sharply from short of length, on the middle, cramping Tharanga who stabbed it to left of Sammy
Fuller in length, in the zone outside off, left alone.
rushes through the channel outside off, left alone
lands on the good length, around the off stump, patted to the off side
beaten outside off. Tharanga tried to drive on the up and did not make contact
down the leg side, from short of the length, evades the glance but runs of  the thigh pad to the fine-leg boundary
short in length, just outside off stump, steered past backward point for a single
leans forward and lets a length delivery outside off well alone
shuffles across, gets behind the line of a length delivery and defends to the off side
short in length, slanted across, sliced to point
full in length, around off and middle, punched to covers.
on a length, straightens and moves towards middle, pushed to the off side.
fuller and Tharanga is beaten on the drive. Ramdin appeals for a catch, Powell doesn't and the umpire agrees with the bowler
short in length, on the middle stump line, again straightens - he has done that consistently today- and jabbed to the off side
slanted across Tharanga who manages to run it down to third man. He pushed at it, bat away from the body
short in length, on the middle and leg, Tharanga tries to chip it over square leg, mistimes it in the air between square leg and mid-on
similar line and length and Sanga gets inside the line and chips it to fine leg region for a single
short in length, outside off, steered to wide third man
just outside off stump and Sangakkara turns it to right of square leg fielder for a single
short in length, outside off stump, punched, off the back foot, in the air but drops short of the diving Chattergoon at point
gets inside the line and pushes his bat inside the line
shoulders arms at a delivery angling across him. Powell is in midst of a very very good tight spell
and again. Sangakkara has been pretty cautious today
leans forward to dead-bat a length delivery around the off stump line
almost chopped on. Full and just outside off, Sanga, who has been leaving quite a few deliveries, has a slash this time and gets a inside-edge and past the off stump
leans forward to defend a length delivery to the off side
beaten on the flirt. A length delivery angling across Tharanga and he tries to run it down to third man
beaten. It landed on a length, around the off and middle, straightened and cuts Tharanga into half. I don't know how it missed the stumps.
well outside the off stump and left alone. The pitch is offering some seam movement and the bowling has been pretty good in general.
slower, full and outside off, driven straight to covers.
length delivery outside off stump, punched to point
short and outside off, Tharanga breaks free with a fierce slash over backward point
shorter, bit more effort and at the rib cage, tucked to square leg
in the zone outside off, Tharanga was on the move and had a poke and a miss
short in length, outside off stump, mistimes a cut to point
short in length, outside off stump, dabbed to third man
leans forward to drive to mid-off
short in length, just outside off stump, pushed to point
on a length, around the off stump, jabbed to the off side, towards cover and they rush across for a quick single
edged to third man. Short in length, outside off and slashed away.
fuller, around the off stump and Tharanga feels for it and gets a inside-edge to square leg
ooh it jumped from short of length and thudded into the gloves. Nasty one. He leaned forward to defend but was surprised at the extra bounce
on a length, angled across, steered to third man
on the hips, tucked to square leg
beaten outside off stump. Full in length, shaping away at the last minute and Tharanga pushes inside the line.
oh a snorter. It leaped up at his throat and he took out the bottom-hand off the handle and managed to fend it to the leg side. A very well-directed bouncer.
another lifter, chest-high this time and defended to the leg side
length delivery, slanted across the batsman who steers to third man for a single
short and wide, slash and a miss
dropped by Fidel. Very tough chance. Tharanga mistimed a uppish off drive and Edwards ran to his right at mid-off and dived full stretch but couldn't hold on
high bouncer and ducked under
on a length, lands on middle and leg, moves towards middle, pushed down the track
short in length, outside off stump and tapped to wide third man
fullish, on the off stump, jabbed to the off side
gentle seam-up delivery, defended on the front foot
a tad short in length, angled across, tapped to backward point
A rare boundary. Tharanga drove a full delivery through wide mid-off
full and angled across Sangakkara who has a lame poke and a miss
shuffles across, to tuck a short of length delivery to square leg
short of length, on the stumps, tapped to leg side
fuller, just outside the off stump, defended to covers
Short, wide, slashed to wide third man. Tharanga's laborious effort comes to an end. He sliced it to left of Taylor who held on to it. Bravo punches his fist in delight.
short in length, straightens, he is cramped up, stabs, gets a top edge and it pos up in the air but there is no one close to catch. Bravo jumps in agony and goes down to the ground
shuffles across to defend a length delivery to covers
on a length, on the middle, turned to the leg side.
fullish and driven crisply to the left of mid-on where Chanderpauls makes a fine diving stop to cut off three runs
full in length, on the middle, punched down the ground, it bounces over the bowler and the mid-on fielder moves to his right to make the stop
beaten. Sanga tried to steer to thirdman but only met thin air
shorter and tapped towards backward point and they rush across for a quick single. Bravo throws but misses and a diving tumbling Sanga makes it in time
shuffles to defend to the off side
on a length, outside off, defended to the off side
length delivery outside off stump, good carry and some movement, Weeraratne withdraws his bat from the line at the very last minute

Direct hit from Sammy. Almost run out. Weeraratne had turned a short of length delivery past square leg and turned for the second run. Even as the ball was about to disturb the furniture he dived in, bat on the ground. We needed better angles. The bat looked as if it lifted but that particular angle was obstructed by the square-leg umpire. The benefit of doubt goes to the batsman. Just in, I guess.
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
full pitched outside off, driven to the off side
beaten on the drive outside off
leans forward to defend a full length delivery on the middle stump
Fullish and outside off, leans forward to crash it through covers
back of a length but too straight and he works it past square leg
tries to cut but mistimes the shot to point
sees a full and wide one and goes for an expansive drive with no footwork, and misses completely
now he connects, heaving from outside off stump for a couple through the gap at midwicket, very well fielded by Sammy in the deep, diving
this one's short and he pulls aerially past square leg
slower ball, full on the stumps and he pushes to mid-off
walks right across his stumps, Sammy sees him and adjusts the line and he can   only play it back to him
comes forward again and drives the fuller one into the covers
hammered away towards square leg to raise the 100
thats a shocker, very wide outside off stump, beats the 'keeper
gets back and punches a shorter one to mid-off
tries to cut it late but is beaten by the extra bounce, well kept by Ramdin
full and flat on middle, flicked wide of midwicket and runs hard
thats shorter and he pulls it for a single
soft dismissal! Gayle bowls a loopy full toss from around the stumps, sliding down leg stump, but Sangakkara can only sweep it to square leg
driven wide in the air just past Chanderpaul at midwicket, was very close
fired in flat and he drives it wide of Gayle
gets another single with a nudge towards the circle
leans forward to drive through the off side
The fourth wicket is down. Full in  length, width outside off stump and he square drove uppishly but straight to backward point. Weeraratne is gone and Sri Lanka slid further.
outside off stump and steered to third man for a single
on a length and leans forward to push it into the gap at cover point for a single
gentle seam-up, straight delivery outside off stump and he opens the bat-face to run it down for a single to third man region
straighter and driven to mid-on
full in length, leans forward to push it to covers
quite similar delivery, quite similar forward prod

one more wicket even as rain drops fall. Really full delivery, he went forward, the left leg went across and he ended up yorking himself. He tried to jab it away but the ball squeezed through just before the bat could come down. It is raining wickets here at Port-of-Spain.

inn2.comm: In the zone outside the off stump, Gayle lets it go.
on a length, turned past square leg
on a length, angling away from Bravo who guides to point. The crowd are chanting his name.
full in length, on the middle and off and Bravo works it to square leg region
Gayle strikes the gong. He jumps out and picks up a full delivery on the legs over square leg.
lands outside the off stump on a length and shapes away, left alone
fires in a yorker, just outside the off stump, jabbed to the leg side. Light drizzle on
shout for lbw but he was struck outside off. It came in from outside off stump, Bravo was neither forward or back, the bat came down in an angle and he was struck just outside off.
beaten outside off. Again, the bat comes down in an angle, well outside the line and the ball rushes through the bat and pad gap
shuffles across, gets outside off stump, behind the line, jabs it to cover point for a quick single. The ball dropped off the bat, on to the boot and Gyale had rushed across before Bravo responded
Beaten. In the channel and Gayle is tempted by the programming and flirts.
He really went after that one. He moved his back leg outside off, opened his stance completely and had a big swing. The ball sliced off the outer edge and went to the left of wide third man region
pitches outside off stump and shapes away, Gayle went back and across and pushed inside the line. Beaten.
backs away to the leg side, Vaas aims for the off stump and Gayle is cramped up as he doesn't find the width or the length for a slog and stabs it away in time.
back to the corridor outside off and Gayle shoulders arms
similar line and again Gayle lets it go past him
beaten again. It came in the air, towards the off stump and as Gayle shaped to defend, it left him late.
slips on to the pads and is tucked past square for a single.
Wild swing and a miss. Full, angled across Gayle who had a almighty heave but couldn't connect
short in length and he went for a pull over midwicket and ended up mistiming it for a single past square leg

The first wicket is down. The off stump has been pushed back. It landed on a length, outside the off stump and cut back in sharply and Bravo, who has been bringing his bat down in an angle, leaving a big gap, pushed at it well outside the line and is cleaned up.
Cuts in from outside the off stump, Sarwan chooses to leave and it shaves past the off stump
shout for lbw but going down leg. It landed on a length, on the middle and leg and moved in. Sarwan fell over a touch as his feet went nowhere and the balance went awry
straightens after landing on a length around off stump, Sarwan is confidently behind it and plays with the full face of the bat towards covers
Full and on the middle and leg, flicked to deep square-leg region for couple of runs
outside off stump, moving away, left alone. WI need 113 more to win.
shapes in this  time and Gayle is cramped up, gets his bat down in a hurry to keep it out towards cover point. And almost a mix-up between him and Sarwan.
on a length, turned past square leg for a single
leans forward to push a length delivery to mid-on for a single
just outside the off stump and squeezed to backward square for a single
Gayle is gone and West Indies in a bit of bother here. 15 for 2. Gayle backed away a touch and tried to heave a full delivery on the stumps over the on-side field but hit it head-high to mid-on.
down the leg side, brushes the thigh pad and Sangakkara dives acrobatically, full length, to collect.
angled across Chanders with a bit of bounce. Perfect line and length.
full pitched outside off stump and Chanders eases it to cover region and Dilshan pulls it just back from the ropes with a diving sliding attempt. Udawatte then fires the throw back in

Two in this over. Trapped in front. It cut in from outside the off stump, from a length, Sarwan was on the walk, his front feet had not even landed on the ground when he was struck in front. Too late to get forward and he has been caught in front.
Samuels, in midst of a horror run, is continuing with his unconvincing and rather tentative shuffle across the sticks. He manages to squeeze a full delivery off the inner edge to square-leg region
length delivery that straightens around the off stump, poked back down the track
stops on the batsman a touch and Samuels adjusts by waiting and opening the bat-face to steer it to left of backward point
length delivery outside off stump and guided to third man for a single
lands around the off stump, moves away a touch, Samuels follows the movement and runs it down to third man. 103 from 110. The drizzle has stopped, btw.
on a length but width offered and Chanderpaul cuts hard but Dilshan intercepts with a fine diving stop at point
leans forward to defend to covers
Shot! Full and hint of inswing, just outside the off stump, Samuels arrests his shuffle and drives crisply between Vaas and mid-off. Elegant stroke, that.
And a streaky one to the fine-leg boundary. It was angled across Samuels, who was on the shuffle, ended up outside off and tried to dab it to third man but got a profitable edge
on the off stump line, tucked to square leg for a single
on the middle, straightens and Chanderpaul wanted to turn it to the on side and that late movement saw him pushing it down the track
fuller but drifts down leg side, flicked to long leg for a single
just outside off and defended on the front foot
outside the off stump, slash and a miss
And again. Cramped for room. He wanted to cut it but couldn't connect.

loud loud appeal by Sanga for a catch. Taufel is unmoved. It jumped from a length, just outside the off stump and again straightened. Chanderpaul, again, went for a cut -- not the line for it- and missed.
Predetermined pull. He moved back and across just before release and pulled a slightly short-of-length delivery over midwicket
Chanderpaul goes down town. Off he rushed down the track and heaved a length delivery over wide long-on. That was some hit. Up up and over.
Murder! He threatened to jump out before going back and Weeraratne offered a short delivery which was dismissed with a pull shot. Chanders is going berserk here.
shuffles outside off and squirts a full delivery to short fine leg region for a single
Whoa! Shot boss! He just leaned forward and swung, almost nonchalantly, a full delivery on the off stump line over midwicket boundary. He is on a roll here.
fuller, yorker length, outside off and jabbed to mid-off for a single.
full, straight, turned to midwicket and Silva fires in a direct hit at the striker's end and the batsmen take the overthrows!
sends across a bouncer, Samuels is late on the hook and Sanga gathers
on a length, on the middle and leg, clipped past square leg
Mendis, the mystery spinner, is here. full and on the leg and middle, turned to midwicket.
full again, driven to long-off for a single
floated full outside leg stump, lapped around the corner. It was a off break
straighter, on the middle and worked past square leg. This one was the attempted doosra, the flick of the finger on one side off the ball but it's pretty wet ball out there

loud appeal but not given by Taufel. That was pretty close. Almost done in by the googly. Samuels charged out, had a heave, missed and the ball broke back in to strike him in front of middle. He was well down the track of course but that was going towards the stumps
outside the off stump, a tad short in length, cut to wide third man for a single
length delivery on the off and middle, tapped to the leg side. The shuffle is still there.
down the leg side, Samuels misses but it's a wide
came in towards the middle, tucked to short fine leg
slower one , full and outside off, Samuels checks his drive and tries to run it down late, misses and Sanga collects.
short in length, outside off, guided to third man for a single
full and on the middle, pushed back down the track
it lands on a length outside off, shapes away,  - that flick of the finger again - pushed to point for a single
off break this time. The grip is entirely on just one side of the ball and it breaks back in, beats the paddle, off the bottom edge and runs off the pad
loopy flighted delviery  - attempted googly - and Chanders takes it on the full to on drive to deep midwicket
streaky edge past the lone slip. It went away from Samuels - he just flicks his finger on the outside side off the ball in the direction towards slips- Samuels pushes at it tentatively and edges it
leans forward, picks the ball off the turf and guides to point
just outside the leg stump, turns in and top-edges a sweep to deep backward square leg.
keeps low after landing on a length, straight on the middle and it went off the pad and bat to the off side. Big appeal from Sanga but it was probably just going outside off. Close
short of length, clipped in front of square leg
on the pad, turned to short fine-leg fielder
fuller and Samuels mistimes a drive and the bowler lunges to his left to make the stop
outside the off stump, cut straight to backward point. Just a single off this over, so far
cut this time to right of wide third man for a single.
lands on the length, around off moves away and pushed back down the track.
again that flick of the finger and again the ball moves away, defended on the front foot
a touch short and pushed past point
beaten by the googly. From back of the hand and Chanderpaul lunged forward, tried to flick, missed and it hit the back pad
fingers on the ball, one of 'em flicking it towards the leg side and Chanderpaul is cramped as he picks it up late and turns to the leg side
outside the off stump, it cut back in and Chanderpaul gets his bat down in a hurry and cuts it through backward point
short in length, around the off stump, pushed to point. 50 from 59 balls.
slower one  but Samuels picks it up and swings the full one high over wide midwicket. Just over the ropes. 44 from 58 now. The batsmen get across for a chat.
short of length, on the middle and leg, clipped past square leg for a single.
fullish, on the middle, whipped to midwicket
a tad slower and Chanderpaul drives  to covers
shorter in length and that allows Chanders to work it past square leg
Chanderpaul thrusts his front leg across,  goes down on his knee and laps a short-of-length delivery around the off stump over the short fine-leg fielder. Scooped over.
gentle mediumpace, full and on the off stump line, driven to long-off
outside off, on a length, steered to third man
the slower one, on the leg and mdidle, flicked past square leg
on the middle, worked to midwicket
through the vacant slip region. It landed on a length, around middle and off and cut away, brushed the thigh pad and went past Sanga, who was standing up to the stumps
leans forward to drive to long-off for a single
on the middle and leg, clipped in front of square
slower one, full and on the middle, mistimes a on drive to left of midwicket. It is pretty dark out there. 30 from 45 balls.

Clean hit. Lovely swing of the bat. He took out the front leg from the line and hit through the line of a length delivery over long-on. Samuels didn't bother to run and stood and watched the white ball sail over the ropes.
a touch short of length, outside off, cut past backward point
stays back to punch to wide long-off, they think about the second run but decide against it
charges down the track and heaves a full delivery one bounce to long-off
lovely loopy delivery, Chanders comes down the track and it dips rapidly on him and he pushes it past the bowler
a tad quicker, just outside off stump, pushed to covers
on the leg and middle,  squeezed to square leg
That one has been deposited to the upper tire at the long-off stands. It was the loopy googly and Samuels rushed down the track and swung it over the boundary. Super hit that.
Full in length, outside the off stump and Chanders clears mid-off but he had sliced it a bit and hence, it didn't go the full distance
low full toss, driven to left of deep cover.
short in length, around the off stump and Chanderpaul brings his fifty up with a cut to right of covers
high bouncer and Samuels ducks
yorker length, just outside off, stabbed to point
another one almost at the blockhole, defended to the off side

another one really full, samuels gets his fifty with a drive to left of mid-on and he celebrates in fury. He punches the air, almost in anger, raises his bat to the pavilion and then punches the bat forcefully in the air. Chanders rushes across to hug him. This is about proving a point. This knock obviously means a lot to him
tucked behind square leg
outside the off stump, stays back to force it to right of covers
Chanders gets the winning runs with a tap to the square leg region. They have won the series. The players in the dressing room erupt in joy. Mahela shakes hands with Chanderpaul. Game over.
